Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I improved my Spanish vocabulary, speaking skills, reading skills, and composition skills. I reached an intermediate to advanced level of proficiency in the language.
I regained and improved my Spanish skills and felt much more proficient by the end.
My Spanish improved dramatically, much more confidence and comfort with speaking especially.
I really gained confidence in speaking Spanish and mastered new grammar structures that let me speak more complexly. Im also better at understanding Spanish speaking.
just about every area of my Spanish improved.

Strengths: Very good for improving language ability, excellent professor, interesting variety of material (videos, movies, readings). Weaknesses: Some aspects of the course were not incredibly helpful - for example, the Supersite is very expensive for how much it costs.
The VHL central homework could have been more consistent

Weaknesses: probably just the textbook, the organization is pretty poor. Class is also very long but still beneficial. You will spend a LOT of your time in this class. Tests are a bit too long for the hour you get but still manageable. 
Strengths: Class is well taught, Sra. Valle's teaching is awesome. Never judgmental and very welcoming. In class video shorts and movies are always insightful and concern themselves with important themes, and the others are very clever and fun to watch. Overall a strong class.
Prof Valle is great, the format of the class is really good, and it helped me feel more confident speaking. Weaknesses were the class textbook/the extremely expensive online workbook subscription.
Yes. I would recommend this course to a student interested in committing himself to improving his/her Spanish and wanting to satisfy two language requirements at once.

I would definitely recommend this course if you want to improve your Spanish. It offers plenty of practice, Professor Valle is engaging and thoughtful, and especially considering it is 2 credits the course has a reasonable workload. I found it very manageable and often pretty enjoyable. Sometimes the 2 hours would feel very slow, but other times they flew by. The movies we watched and stories we read were also really good.
Yes! Professor Valle is amazing, you will enjoy your class with her.

Absolutely would recommend this course, my Spanish improved so much. The balance between speaking/listening, reading/writing is really good, and I particularly feel more confident with speaking. Feedback is consistent and helpful, and you can always ask for more help if you need it.
Absolutely! A lot of work but very fun and the time passes very quickly

If you are serious about improving your Spanish, I would highly recommend it. Professor Valle is a wonderful instructor and makes the class engaging and fun. Meeting for two hours everyday, you really get to know the other people in your class and ours was a truly a community by the end of the term.
Yes, especially to get the credit out of the way.
Yes - take this class if you want to learn Spanish and really be immersed in the language every day.
